ai.summary: Aira Force and Gowbarrow Trail is a 14.9 km circular hike in the UK that combines a visit to the Aira Force waterfall with a climb to Gowbarrow Summit, offering woodland paths, streams, and wide views over the surrounding countryside. The route is rated moderate and suits walkers with some hiking experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail uses a mix of well used footpaths, forest tracks, and some uneven rocky sections. You will encounter boardwalks near Aira Force, grassy lanes, and a steady ascent to Gowbarrow Summit. After rain the surface can be muddy and slippery, so good footwear is important.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather forecasts before setting out, as conditions can change quickly on exposed upland ground. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and bring warm layers and a waterproof jacket. Stay on marked paths, carry a map or offline navigation, and have a charged phone. Bring sufficient water and snacks, and let someone know your planned return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Waterproof jacket and an extra warm layer
Map or offline GPS and compass
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
Headlamp or small flashlight (for late finishes)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal for this hike, with May to October offering the best weather and views. Winter can be cold and muddy; plan for shorter daylight hours and more challenging conditions.
